09/2020– 03/2021   |                 NASHVILLE, TN, USA 
 
Project               : Online Quiz Application 
Language            : VC++  and  MFC (Microsoft Foundation Class) 
 
Project Description and key work areas: 
• Developed an interactive online quiz application using VC++ and MFC, 
highlighting proficiency in object-oriented programming and user interface 
design. 
• Designed a user-friendly graphical interface using a library like Qt, allowing 
users to take quizzes on various subjects. 
• Designed a user-friendly GUI with MFC dialog boxes, property sheets, and 
controls (list views, tree views, etc.). 
• Utilized MFC's document/view architecture for organizing data and UI 
elements. 
• Implemented a question bank system with multiple-choice questions,

controls (list views, tree views, etc.). 
• Utilized MFC's document/view architecture for organizing data and UI 
elements. 
• Implemented a question bank system with multiple-choice questions, 
showcasing your ability to handle data structures for quiz content. 
• Created login screen in MFC. 
• Created a timer feature for each question, adding an element of challenge and 
urgency to the quiz experience. 
• Incorporated a scoring system that calculated and displayed scores based on 
the number of correct answers and completion time. Result windows created in 
MFC. 
• Utilized file handling to save user scores and quiz results, enabling users to 
review their performance later. 
• Added features like hints, skip options, and explanations for correct answers to 
enhance user engagement. 
• Collaborated with peers to gather feedback and iteratively improve the 
application's usability and quiz variety.

Senior Software Engineer 
JAI GANESH INDUSTRIES 
01/2019– 03/2020   |                 Pune, MH, India 
 
Project               : 1)Mechanical Production Inventory Management 
                              2)Payroll Management 
Language            : C++ , VC++ and MFC 
 
Project Description and key work areas: 
• JAI GANESH INDUSTRIES is small startup mechanical- production firm. I 
developed different small projects here. All project was using Windows OS 
only. 
• Mechanical Production Inventory Management Description: 
o Inventory control: This includes tasks such as ordering, receiving, storing, 
and tracking inventory. 
o Inventory analysis: This involves using data to identify trends and make 
decisions about inventory levels. 
o Inventory reporting: This includes creating reports on inventory levels, 
costs, and turnover.

decisions about inventory levels. 
o Inventory reporting: This includes creating reports on inventory levels, 
costs, and turnover. 
o Inventory management systems: This includes using software to track 
inventory levels and manage inventory transactions. 
o Inventory safety: This includes taking steps to prevent damage to 
inventory and theft. 
o Created MFC dialogs for recording Login, ordering, receiving transactions. 
o Generated reports using MFC's reporting controls or external libraries. 
• Project Accomplishments: 
Reduced inventory costs by 10%. 
Increased inventory accuracy by 5%. 
Improved inventory turnover by 20%. 
 
• Project Description: Developed a VC++ and MFC program to manage 
employee payroll information.  
o The system includes the following features: 
o Add, edit, and delete employee records 
o Calculate and generate employee paychecks 
o Track employee leave and vacation time 
o Generate reports on employee payroll data

o Add, edit, and delete employee records 
o Calculate and generate employee paychecks 
o Track employee leave and vacation time 
o Generate reports on employee payroll data 
o Print the salary slip for a particular employee  
• The project has different classes and subclasses with several features in 
them. Designed a user-friendly GUI with MFC dialog boxes, property sheets, 
and controls (list views, tree views, etc.). 
• Created print layouts for reports using MFC's printing capabilities. 
• Project Accomplishments 
o Developed a robust and user-friendly payroll management system 
o Successfully implemented the system in a production environment 
o Reduced the time it takes to process payroll by 50% 
• Data API used to provide access to payroll data, such as employee 
information, tax rates, and benefit information. Transaction APIs used allow 
you to create, update, and delete payroll transactions. Reporting APIs used to

information, tax rates, and benefit information. Transaction APIs used allow 
you to create, update, and delete payroll transactions. Reporting APIs used to 
generate reports on payroll data. Integration APIs used to integrate your payroll 
management system with other systems, such as your human resources 
system or your accounting system.

Software Engineer 
DASSAULT SYSTÈMES GLOBAL SERVICES 
 
01/2011 – 01/2014   |                 Pune, MH, India 
 
Project              : CATIA - Visualization 
Language           : C++ and CAA (Component Application Architecture) 
 
Project Description and key work areas: 
• CATIA is Dassault Systems Pioneer Brand. It is the World's Leading Solution 
for Product Design and Innovation. 
The project involves lot of design and development related work. The goal of 
the project is to maintain the existing system and also develop new 
applications required for the enhancements of the system.  
• Project was in CAA.CAA is an acronym for Component Application 
Architecture. CATIA CAA is a comprehensive and open set of APIs to be fully 
integrated into Dassault Systems Portfolio. 
• The Visualization project of CATIA involves handling whole rendering 
(visualization) of different texts and fonts used in CATIA. 
• Worked on text rendering engine for True Type and Open Type fonts.

(visualization) of different texts and fonts used in CATIA. 
• Worked on text rendering engine for True Type and Open Type fonts. 
• Maintenance on Windows font linking behavior and support for True Type 
Collection and True Type Extension (Especially important for East Asian 
customers). 
• Old versions of CATIA using Stroke Fonts (In house fonts), handled issues 
related to stroke fonts 
• Development of text related UI components for newly developed in-house 
declarative immersive UI. 
• Accountable for developing new applications for enhancement and 
maintenance of the existing system. 
• Study of program specifications, analysis, enhancements and documentation 
of the system. 
• Recording testing scenario and writing ODT (test case) using shell scripting. 
• Resolving the abends, memory leaks and issues. 
• Handled issues on UNIX and mac OS too. 
• Handled weekly calls with counterpart.

Project Description and key work areas:

different geometries, grid, tessellations and texts and fonts used in CATIA.  
• I Worked on CAD products like CATIA, SIMULLIA, DELMIA and SolidWorks 
V6.

modules.

immersive UI for V6.
